summary: The Protect Honduran Democracy Act directs the Secretary of State to create a strategy for monitoring the November 30, 2025, general elections in Honduras. The bill aims to promote free and fair elections by supporting election monitoring, preventing harassment of candidates, and ensuring transparent results. It also authorizes assistance to NGOs for election monitoring and imposes sanctions on individuals who undermine the electoral process. The bill encourages the Secretary of State to promote voter participation of Honduran citizens in the United States and authorizes appropriations for this purpose.
